project.teaser: With an aging population and >55 million dementia cases worldwide; treatments are more needed than ever. However, effective treatments are lacking, with solutions only stalling dementia progress and no real disease-modifying effect. ATI has developed AT-001, a new drug with...
project.objective: With an aging population and >55 million dementia cases worldwide; treatments are more needed than ever. However, effective treatments are lacking, with solutions only stalling dementia progress and no real disease-modifying effect. ATI has developed AT-001, a new drug with the potential to stop and revert the disease, and to delay its onset. AT-001 has been developed through the DNACA precision-medicine based platform, which applies Big Data mining and Deep Learning/AI algorithms to identify patients with validated biomarkers. AT-001 is different in that it prevents aggregation of amyloid/tau proteins, common in many types of dementia. Phase IIa clinical trials have shown strong effects in the treatment of HCCAA. We will now carry out a registration trial for commercialization in Iceland and POC studies in Europe to obtain NDA in familial dementia, thereby informing the treatment of Alzheimers Disease (60% of dementia cases), potentially changing the lives of millions for the better.
project.title: Dementia/Alzheimer Drug Attributed to Cystatin-C and other mutations – precision medicine drug development
project.keywords: Precision medicine, big data,therapy,genomics,genetics, dementia,Alzheimer's disease,hereditary cerebral amyloid angiopathies,drug development,biobank

project.teaser: The Sustainable Careers for Researcher Empowerment (SECURE) project will develop coordination and support measures to create, trial, implement, and mainstream a common Research Career Framework (RCF) that offers a suite of options to support organisations in the recruitment...
project.objective: The Sustainable Careers for Researcher Empowerment (SECURE) project will develop coordination and support measures to create, trial, implement, and mainstream a common Research Career Framework (RCF) that offers a suite of options to support organisations in the recruitment, employment, training, development, progression, and mobility of researchers with the aim of improving research careers and reducing career precarity. The RCF will recognise the research profession across sectors, provide a career development and progression structure for research careers, recognise both research and transferable skills and competences, facilitate intersectoral collaboration and mobility, and offer solutions to the precariousness of research careers in academia. SECURE will test aspects of the RCF and TTL models in trials in four RPOs, one RFO, and one recruitment agency . The trial organisations will first conduct a scoping exercise to map the RCF onto their existing policies and activities for research careers before developing integration plans on how the RCF could be adopted into their existing policies and activities. Due to the short duration of the project and window for trials, it is expected that only some aspects of the RCF and TTL models will be tested. The trial organisations will thus develop actions plans, selecting relevant aspects from the integration plans, to test and implement during the trials. SECURE will mainstream the RCF and TTL models through a series of policy briefs and a summit that explain key aspects of the RCF and TTL models to relevant organisations employing researchers. The RCF and TTL models will be further promoted through key partner organisations in the project targeting researchers, RPOs, and companies. The RCF and TTL models will lastly be promoted in the EURAXESS network including the many EURAXESS service centres, the newly established EURAXESS hubs, and through the ERA Talent Platform being developed.

result.description: Common project framework, including (1) Initial briefing on SECURE objectives, concepts and methodology (2) Communication protocol Template questionnaires and data collection (4) Reporting formats (5) Ensuring common Action (6) QH stakeholder engagement approaches

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: Data Management Plan (DMP) which will cover data management methodology including project wide database, data standards, verification and reuse strategy, curation, preservation using the HORIZON EUROPE online manual. The DMP will be updated over the course of the project whenever significant changes arise

result.title: First Draft of SECURE Tenure Track-Like Models
result.description: First draft of the TTL models based on the literature reviews from WP1 and key existing policies and recommendations on TTL models. This will include selecting a range of best practices covering different TTL models and conducting in-depth interviews with selected candidates focusing on the legal, financial, and administrative implementation of these TTL models as well as the challenges faced and lessons learned

result.title: First Draft of SECURE Research Career Framework
result.description: First draft of the RCF based on the literature reviews from WP1 and key existing policies and recommendations aimed at improving research careers and reducing precarity. This will include the integration of key policies and recommendations in the new Council Recommendations on Research Careers and the revised Charter and Code, how organisations can utilise the update to ESCO and the Competence Framework for Researchers, and other relevant legal and financial recommendations

result.title: Exploitation Plan
result.description: Exploitation plan which will utilise project results for societal and scientific purposes by concretising the value and impact of the SECURE framework. The Exploitation plan will be updated over the course of the project whenever significant changes arise

result.title: Risk Management Plan
result.description: Risk Management Plan (RMP) to cover all risks including Operational, Financial, Business, Socio-Economic, Health & Safety and External Risks. The RMP will include the development of risk mitigation strategies and application of contingency in order to complete project and WP objectives on time and in budget. It will also include protocols if a WP leader does not deliver on time or fail to deliver a Deliverable

project.teaser: Celiac disease is an autoimmune indication for which there is no cure. Only the life-long avoidance of the disease causing gliadin protein in gluten is available as a sub-optimal and cumbersome necessity for CD patients. We developed a unique novel combination of antigen...
project.objective: Celiac disease is an autoimmune indication for which there is no cure. Only the life-long avoidance of the disease causing gliadin protein in gluten is available as a sub-optimal and cumbersome necessity for CD patients. We developed a unique novel combination of antigen (gliadin protein), probiotic tolerogenic bacterial particles (TBPs) and mouth patch technology to enhance the bioavailability and tolerance induction. Synergistic tolerizing properties of the TBP-antigen combination and the therapeutic effect of the SOMIT concept has been shown in a suitable pig model. Our SOMIT-CD promises to require a short-course weekly treatment for less than 3 months in CD patients. This EIC project will allow us to finalize the various preclinical activities and perform phase Ib/IIa clinical study, paving the way to closing a co-development deal with a big pharma player. After market entry in 2029, we aim to reach a market share of 15% and generate annual revenues of 148M by 2033.
project.title: Novel First-in-Class Specific Oromucosal Immunotherapy (SOMIT) to treat Celiac Disease (CD)
project.keywords: Autoimmune disorders,Oralmucosa,Mouth patch,Celiac disease,Immunotherapy,Tolerizing effect,Antigen

article.title: Curing coeliac disease with a mouth patch
